title: Elegant Expensive fonts?
content:
Looking for fonts that are elegant, classy, that say "too much money"

Need two fonts one more extravagant for a display name one clean and sheik for the less important headline.

Any ideas?
author: j_polo9

comments.content:
[http://www.orangeitalic.com/luxury/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308211553/http:/www.orangeitalic.com/luxury/ "http://www.orangeitalic.com/luxury/")

these don't just _say_ expensive, they _are_ expensive.

Wasn’t the price $299? Not _that_ expensive.

What’s the deal with Orange Italic? Aren’t these House fonts?

_Wasn’t the price $299? Not that expensive._  
the website quotes $1500 for a 5-user license.

_Aren’t these House fonts?_  
Well, the _will be_. House previewed them in their Artist Proof catalog.
I like [HTF Didot.](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308211553/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/didot/index.html)
The font 'Diamond' appears to be the one that is used for the Prada logo, so it's definitely found it's use in an upper-class context.

I’m quite sure there was a thread (can’t find it though) about the Luxury collection being ready and that they were working on the advertising material _and_ that if you wanted it early, you could get it by emailing Rich.

I think it said somewhere that the price would be $299. Because it’s the same price as Chalet and Neutra, it’s easy for me to remember. I guess I could be wrong.

The Prada logo doesn't use a font, but Diamond is certainly inspired by it.

Check out the " [engravers](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308211553/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&startrow=1&records=20&currpage=1&totalrecords=16&searchby=&searchID=&searchletter=&searchstr=engraver&font_categories_checkbox=font_name_search&fontRendererText=Prada+Fancy)" fonts for more highbrow luxury.

oh very nice! If its 299 im pretty sure i could get the client to pony up. And the Engravers fonts are nice.

Are their any other font options though? Didot is of course nice but its seems like the default font for "classy". Looking for something maybe a little less used for that.

Just email Rich at House and we’ll find out, right?

[Peignot](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308211553/http:/www.linotype.com/1328/peignot-family.html?PHPSESSID=b5a73b32ece05398e1fd6117f58551c9) is also kinda classy but I somehow don’t like it and yet… I don’t know. Maybe it’s the mixed case.

btw peignot is used on Real Madrid's shirts :D. one of the richest footbal clubs.

I like Bodoni and Didot (they pretty similar).

Jesse,

Please have a look at my typefaces to see if you find any of them classy enough? And if you think they are to cheap... I could easily double or even triple the price for you ;-)

[http://www.macrhino.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308211553/http:/www.macrhino.com/ "http://www.macrhino.com")

\> I could easily double or even triple the price for you ;-)

Good idea. Custom price :)
Grot - Nice suggestion. [Peignot](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308211553/http:/typographi.com/001054.php) in all caps helps you forget the mixed case.

ahh stefan I am a sucker for swedish design! I like a lot of your typefaces, howerver your site is a bit of a pain to use, unfortunately.

I'll send you a message tomorrow and ask more about your services. Also I am wondering which of your typefaces would you consider proclaims "wealthy"? (im not trying to be smart I just want to know your thoughts)

Direct from Sweden.

Unfortunately not released/finished yet, but hopefully sometime in the autumn it will be available at Psy/Ops. Or what do you say, Stefan? ;-)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308211553im_/http:/typophile.com/files/directsweden_5976.jpg)
jpolo - You can also see Stefan's excellent fonts [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308211553/http:/stewf.com/work/hattenbach).

ahh thanks stephen. It is easier to view the fonts at that site.

One thing that I don't get with the expensive orange set is how are you supposed to know if that font will look good with the brand name you are creating? Without a letters-setter like most foundaries have, not only can I not see how the font will look with the company name, but how do i show it/ sell it to the client?

I mean I could just tell them I found a font i want to use and that they have to pay for before seeing, but I wouldn't do that without me seeing it first either. Not to mention it would be a lot easier to sell them on buying an expensive font if I could actually show how it will look.

On the [Orange Italic web site](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308211553/http:/orangeitalic.com/luxury.shtml), they explain that this was at first an elaborate joke, and then was turned into usable typefaces. They also have [examples](http://web.archive.org/web/20150308211553/http:/www.orangeitalic.com/luxury/) showing the face. The links are there to contact them for more info.

Try to contact the designer direct, probably you then get a chance to either try it before you buy, or maybe get help in setting some headline or something - to be able to see it little better. I think these possibilities should always be availbable. As you said, it's a greater chance to buy the font if you can try it a little bit first - and get convinced.

Btw, I know Stefan is helping potential buyers like this sometimes - so if you want to see some headline or something of Stefan's wonderful fonts - he may very well be able to help you in some way.

Ha that's kind of funny. It's kind of confusing though. I mean they are nice fonts I think, and even if they are expensive for the sake of being expensive it fits a marketing niche. But the fact that they started off as a joke kind of takes away from its prestige i think.

Thanks Goran thats a good idea, for smaller type foundaries i suppose i can just email then for a screenshot or something.

J - Hattenbach's fonts are available through two foundries, PSY/OPS and Fountain. Check the links on my pages. PSY/OPS has a sampler on their site. Fountain fonts are also available at FontShop and Veer which have samplers.

Stefan, would you happen to be working on a thin version of Stalemate? I mean even lighter in weight than the Light version? I'm working on a magazine redesign, and a very light weight sans is one of the requirements. I like Stalemate and am going to consider Anziano and Delicato as text faces. Beautiful work!

Göran and Stephen,

Thanks for nice words about my typefaces and spreading the word etc ;-)

Bruce,

Thanks for your interest in my typefaces. I do have some updates in mind for Stalemate... The primar thing to do, is adding on some Small Caps to the excisting weights. Later on I will expand the family with more weights as well. This will include lighter weights. Anything is possible though depending if you're willing to concider a custom version as a faster soloution for your magazine redesign? Please contact me through e-mail ( [stefan@macrhino.com](mailto:stefan@macrhino.com)) and we could discuss the destials etc.
Fountain does some excellent work. I used Peignot for a pitch to a client doing high end jewellry but ended up going with a custom mark based off URW Imperial, which is also very nice.
Stefan, didn't realize you owned macrhino, I admire your work.
